intro: Vincetoxicum stepposum, commonly known as the steppe vincetoxicum, is a perennial herb native to the grasslands of Eastern Europe and Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its fruits are follicles that release tiny seeds, aiding in its spread across open habitats. Vincetoxicum stepposum is often found in dry, sunny areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
